ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He is the one who harshly rebuffs the orphan
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: It is he who pushes the orphan away,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Such is the one who repulses the orphans away,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: It is he who turns down the orphans
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So it is he, who pushes away the orphan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: That is he who repulses the orphan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: That is the one who treats the orphan with harshness,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: That is he who repulses the orphan
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: That is he who repelleth the orphan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: It is he who pusheth away the orphan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: That is the one, who drives away the orphan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then such is the (man) who repulses the orphan (with harshness),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: That is he who repulses the orphan (harshly),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: It is he who turns away the orphan
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: It is he who mistreats the orphan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: For that is the one who drives away the orphan
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [107:2] That is he (read an implied huwa after the fā’ [of fa-dhālika]) who repels the orphan, that is to say, [who] violently drives him away from what is his due,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (That is he who repelleth the orphan) from his own right; and it is also said this means: he denies the orphan his right,
